reasoning: The query asks about a simple profit-sharing investment agreement. To gain more insight, I will use metaphors from different domains to explore the underlying concepts of risk, reward, effort, and incentives. I'll look at investing as a garden, a collaborative art project, a sports team, a business partnership, and a game of chance. These metaphors should illuminate the potential challenges with the original proposed arrangement from various angles.
generated_metaphors: Investing is like cultivating a garden.
Investing is like a collaborative art project.
Investing is like being on a sports team.
Investing is like running a business partnership.
Investing is like gambling at a casino.
domain_mappings: Gardening: Seeds (Capital), Gardener (Investor), Soil (Market), Harvest (Profit), Weeds/Pests (Risks) -> Investing: Initial investment, Fund manager/Individual investor, Market conditions, Investment returns, Market volatility/Economic downturn

Collaborative Art: Canvas (Investment opportunity), Artists (Investor & Capital Provider), Paint/Brushes (Skills/Resources), Masterpiece (Successful investment), Creative differences (Disagreements on strategy) -> Investing: Underlying asset/business, Investor's Expertise, Trading tools/Market data, Profitable Investment, Conflicting investment styles

Sports Team: Players (investor/capital provider), Coach (financial advisor), Training (due diligence), Game (market), Score (profit) -> Investing: Skills/Capital, Investment strategy, Research, Market conditions, Returns/Losses

Business Partnership: Partners (Investor & Capital Provider), Business Plan (Investment Strategy), Resources (Capital/Expertise), Revenue (Profit), Expenses (Losses) -> Investing: Shared responsibilities, Documented strategy, Shared Costs/Rewards, Investment gains, Investment losses

Gambling: Chips (Capital), Gambler (Investor), Table (Market), Winnings (Profit), Losses (Losses) -> Investing: Initial Investment, Individual, Market conditions, Investment returns, Investment losses
metaphorical_language: Gardening: Seeds, cultivate, harvest, weeds, fertilizer, pruning, soil, irrigation
Art: Canvas, palette, brush, strokes, masterpiece, gallery, composition, perspective
Sports: Team, players, coach, training, game, score, strategy, playoffs
Business: Partnership, revenue, expenses, profit, loss, strategy, market share, competition
Gambling: Chips, bet, odds, winnings, losses, risk, jackpot, probability
extended_metaphors: Gardening: Some seeds are more likely to sprout. A lazy gardener won't get a good harvest even with good seeds. Requires constant tending based on market temperature.

Art: A collaborative art project can fail if artists have dramatically different visions even with good resources. Different styles of art will result in different art pieces, therefore different values.
Sports Team: A team needs both skilled players and a good coach/strategy to win. Even with funding, a team with no strategy will fail. Also, some players can be bad influences to others.

Business Partnership: A partnership needs trust and a clear agreement to succeed. The failure can be attributed to the lack of clarity on contributions, how the profit/loss gets split, and who gets the final say.
Gambling: In gambling, even with good strategy, the house always has an edge. If the investor isn't good, the house will also win. Investing without knowledge is gambling.
augmented_query: "investment partnership agreement", "incentive structures for investment managers", "risk sharing investment strategies", "investment management contracts", "alternative investment incentives", "profit sharing investment risks", "investment performance metrics", "capital allocation strategies"
query: Why can't you just have someone invest for you and split the profits (and losses) with him?
